organization.fullName: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Whole-process Quality Improvement of Endovascular Treatment Basd on an AI-aided Clinical Feedback System
identificationModule.officialTitle: Whole-process Quality Improvement of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke Undergoing Endovascular Treatment Based on an Artificial Intelligence-aided Clinical Feedback System

leadSponsor.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A clustered randomized control trial to evaluate whether multi-aspect intervention based on an AI-aided clinical feedback system could improve the quality of EVT and functional outcome of patients.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Endovascular treatment (EVT) is the standard treatment for acute ischemic stroke (AIS) caused by large vessel occlusion (LVO) according to current guidelines. However, while a rapidly-growing number of stroke centers become capable of performing EVT, the general quality of EVT remains unsatisfied, resulting in a considerable proportion of patients who could not reach functional independence. Our pre-established artificial intelligence (AI)-aided clinical feedback system could dynamically record and report key timepoints of EVT in-hospital process. Combined with multi-aspect intervention via remote/on-site surveillance and education, this may be a potential solution for quality improvement of EVT. Therefore, the aim of the study is to evaluate whether an AI-aided clinical feedback system coupled with multi-aspect intervention could improve the quality of EVT. Twenty hospitals with annual EVT cases \> 30 will be 1:1 randomized into intervention group and control group. The intervention group will receive AI-based clinical feedback system coupled with multi-aspect intervention, including remote/on-site surveillance and education regarding in-hospital workflow and surgical procedures of EVT. The control group only deploys AI-aided clinical feedback system. The primary outcome is the ratio of good functional outcome (mRS \> 2) at 3 month.

armGroups.label: Intervention
armGroups.description: AI-aided clinical feedback system coupled with multi-aspect intervention based on the Behaviour Change Wheel model
interventionNames: Behavioral: AI-aided clinical feedback system coupled with multi-aspect intervention basd on Behaviour Change Wheel model

interventions.name: AI-aided clinical feedback system coupled with multi-aspect intervention basd on Behaviour Change Wheel model
interventions.description: Interventions are developed on a psychological model, the Behaviour Change Wheel (BCW) .The fundamental of BCW consists of three essential elements: capability, motivation, and opportunity. Improving individual's capability, providing motivation, and increasing opportunities are goals of behaviour change intervention. To achieve the goals, 9 intervention components have been proposed in the BCW framework, and 6 components will be used in current study.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of favorable functional outcome at 3 month
primaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of patients with mRS \> 2 at 3-month follow up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of good functional outcome at 3 month
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of patients with mRS \> 1 at 3-month follow up

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of hemorrhagic transformation at 24 hour
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of hemorrhagic transformation at 24 hour after EVT

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage at 24 hour
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ratio of symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage at 24 hour after EVT
Time interval between admission and groin puncture

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of door to groin puncture time < 90 min
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time interval between admission and groin puncture \<90 min

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ratio of door to groin puncture time < 60 min
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time interval between admission and groin puncture \<60 min
Time interval between groin puncture and last time of digital subtraction angiography
Ratio of patients achieving modified thrombolysis in cerebral infarction (mTICI) 2b or 3

otherOutcomes.measure: Ratio of favorable functional outcome at 3 month in patients within 6 hours of stroke onset
otherOutcomes.description: Ratio of mRS \> 2 at 3 month follow-up in patients within 6 hours of stroke onset

otherOutcomes.measure: Door to groin puncture time in patients within 6 hours of stroke onset
otherOutcomes.description: Time interval between admission and groin puncture in patients within 6 hours of stroke onset

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age \> 18
* AIS patients receiving EVT within 24 hours of stroke onset
* Written informed consent is obtained

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients refuse to participate in this study
